data.title: Namma Metro: Interesting and unique facts
data.meta_description: ​PM Modi will inaugurate the 13.71 km stretch from Whitefield (Kadugodi) Metro to Krishnarajapura Metro Line of the Reach-1 extension project under Bangalore Metro Phase 2, at Whitefield Metro Station.
data.text:
Rapid transit system

Bengaluru Metro, also known as Namma Metro, is a rapid transit system serving Bengaluru city. It consists of four colour-coded lines, with a total operational length of 42.3 km and a total of 41 stations.

Purple and Green line

Bengaluru Metro currently operates on the Purple Line and the Green Line.

Metro stations

The Purple Line spans 18.22 kilometres and 17 stations between Baiyappanahalli and Mysore Road. The Green Line connects Nagasandra and Yelachenahalli and spans 24.20 kilometres with 24 stations.

Purple line stops

​This is the first metro rail project in India commissioned with 750V DC Third Rail Traction on Standard Gauge.​

​QR based ticketing​

BMRCL has also launched QR based ticketing through Namma Metro App and WhatsApp instant messaging. BMRCL is First Metro in the Global Transit space to introduce end-to-end ticketing system on WhatsApp.

Information board

Passenger information display boards are installed near the Automatic gates and on platform to provide real-time information to passengers about the arrival of trains.

​KR Puram and Whitefield route

The Metro rail service between KR Puram and Whitefield will reduce the travel time between the two places to 23 minutes from the current one hour (on average) by road.

Extended Purple line

This Metro line is part of the extended Purple Line from Byappanahalli to Whitefield, built under Phase II of Namma Metro project.

Daily ridership

Namma Metro’s daily ridership is now between 5.5 lakh and 6 lakh.
